update.description:
The ign_gui-pr-win jobs have all been failing recently:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign_gui-pr-win&build=117)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_gui-pr-win/117/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_gui-pr-win/117/

The `ign-gui0` file has multiple folders checked out for `ign-cmake`, `ign-math`, and `ign-common` to satisfy its unusual combination of dependencies (see [ign-gui/pull-requests/215](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-gui/pull-requests/215/gui0-use-rendering2/diff)), and the folder names didn't match, so if a job for ign-gui2 ran after a job for ign-gui0, it would have multiple folders with the same cmake project names, which causes a colcon error:

~~~
# BEGIN SECTION: compiling ign-gui
[0.722s] colcon ERROR colcon build: Duplicate package names not supported:
- ignition-cmake2:
  - D:\Jenkins\workspace\ign_gui-pr-win\ws\ign-cmake
  - D:\Jenkins\workspace\ign_gui-pr-win\ws\ign-cmake2
- ignition-common3:
  - D:\Jenkins\workspace\ign_gui-pr-win\ws\ign-common
  - D:\Jenkins\workspace\ign_gui-pr-win\ws\ign-common3
- ignition-math6:
  - D:\Jenkins\workspace\ign_gui-pr-win\ws\ign-math
  - D:\Jenkins\workspace\ign_gui-pr-win\ws\ign-math6
The syntax of the command is incorrect.
Failed in windows_library with error #1.
~~~

This changes the checkout names to ensure that they match the gui1 and gui2 names and also removes the unneeded sdformat checkout.

Testing after a wiped jenkins workspace:

* ign-gui2 the first time would pass without this branch: [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign_gui-pr-win&build=123)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_gui-pr-win/123/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_gui-pr-win/123/

* ign-gui0 (fails for unrelated reason) [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign_gui-pr-win&build=124)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_gui-pr-win/124/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_gui-pr-win/124/

* ign-gui2 passes the second time, which is an improvement over the status quo [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ign_gui-pr-win&build=125)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_gui-pr-win/125/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_gui-pr-win/125/
update.title: Fix ign_gui-pr-win job

content.raw: that cleanup command deletes the gazebodistro folder but not the entire src folder
content.html: that cleanup command deletes the gazebodistro folder but not the entire src folder

content.raw: those jobs you just ran are still using this branch of gazebodistro. You should be able to reproduce the problem using the default branch
content.html: those jobs you just ran are still using this branch of gazebodistro. You should be able to reproduce the problem using the default branch

content.raw: Looks to me that the [clean up command is already in the code ](#!/osrf/release-tools/src/04ccf8b323defc50c1309cf33c9631b9fd203907/jenkins-scripts/lib/windows_library.bat#lines-181), and I’m unable to reproduce the error [playing with the job from build 126 to build 130](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ign_gui-pr-win/) \(note that 128 is failing because an internal compiler problem\).
content.html: Looks to me that the clean up command is already in the code , and I’m unable to reproduce the error playing with the job from build 126 to build 130 (note that 128 is failing because an internal compiler problem).

content.raw: yeah, we probably should clear the workspace before each build, especially for the `pr` builds that can use different branches
content.html: yeah, we probably should clear the workspace before each build, especially for the pr builds that can use different branches

content.raw: I’m afraid that we can find the same problem with some other combinations of gazebodistro files. Would it make more sense to cleanup the colcon workspace before every build?
content.html: I’m afraid that we can find the same problem with some other combinations of gazebodistro files. Would it make more sense to cleanup the colcon workspace before every build?
